intro: Distichirhops mitsemosik, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain a milky sap, which is the source of its common name. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
